document_data.name: Harvest Hall
document_data.staff: [[Harrandave Donohar]] in [[1358 DR]], [[Katriana Donohar]] in [[1374 DR]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Harvest Hall''' was a temple of [[Chauntea]] in the city of [[Wheloon]] in [[Cormyr]].
document_data.Description: The Harvest Hall was the largest temple in Wheloon, but a modest one.
document_data.History:
The Harvest Hall had a long history in Wheloon, dating back nearly as far as the [[Wyvern Ferry]]. It served generations of Whelunians.

By [[1358 DR]], it was headed by [[Harandave Donohar]], a famed [[priest]] of Chauntea. He still held the position in [[1369 DR]].

Following Harandave's death, his daughter [[Katriana Donohar]] took over as head of the temple. She held the position by [[1374]].
document_data.Inhabitants: The temple was led by Harandave Donohar until his death, after which he was succeeded by his daughter, Katriana Donohar. They had thirteen followers or attendants, all minor priests.
document_data.Services:
In addition to regular services, all were welcomed into the Harvest Hall, and it served as a popular local meeting place. During harvest festivals, the temple gave agricultural produce to the poor of Wheloon.

Katriana Donohar was usually at the temple, managing affairs there. She had a large number of [[divine magic|divine]] [[scroll]]s, dating back to Harandave's day, which she sold to those she believed would use them for good deeds. The minor priests often journeyed out into the countryside to assist farmers.
